job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Whittier, CA
pros: Great college campus culture. Faculty are close and share ideas and best practices. Small class sizes.
cons: The salary does not align with the cost of living in Los Angeles.

pros: Students are amazing, best part of the job. Small community.
cons: Lack of communication (transparency?) from Admin. “Top-down” management does not align to sense of community and shared governance. Faculty/Staff are huge stakeholders and they have no say in decisions that directly impact them or their work.

review_title: Will probably be better when it’s Cal State @ Whittier
pros: Campus is some what nice
cons: Horribly mismanaged by a president who probably has never been on campus

job_title: Student Services Aide in Whittier, CA
pros: Very warm and welcoming community
cons: Small College with very limited resources. The manager is really nice but overworked and unmanaged.

pros: Strong team and dedicated staff
cons: Poor leadership from higher administration

job_title: Assistant Director, Counseling Center in Whittier, CA
pros: The college offers great benefits
cons: salary too low. no increases.

pros: Easy and flexible for a college student
cons: Not many hours or benefits

review_title: Run Game Coordinator / Offensive Line Coach
job_title: Assistant Football Coach in Whittier, CA
pros: The relationships made within the athletics department were top-notch. Many like-minded individuals were goal oriented.
cons: Lack of support from the administration

job_title: Work Study Student in Whittier, CA
pros: Great way to make some money in school and on campus
cons: you're a student, so that's a reality

pros: The faculty and staff were some of the nicest people I've ever worked with! The students are hardworking and really great, too. In hindsight, I'm amazed at the opportunities for growth they provided.
cons: Like any small community, there's some interpersonal drama and "he said, she said, they said" that got tiring and distracting. Situations arose in which you had to choose sides. A lot of rumors and gossip.

pros:
Room and board covered plus stipend 
Fun atmosphere if your students respect you 
Very easy connection to social relationships at the college
Upper campus=Mature-ish kids
cons:
You will have no idea how some of the higher staff have a job 
If you are placed in Johnson or stauffer, be ready to work
If you are an athlete, be ready to juggle priorities

pros: gave me great experience to use in my career
cons: it only paid minimum wage

review_title: Great place to get your feet wet
job_title: Associate Director of Admissions in Whittier, CA
pros: Excellent mission, ethos, and commitment to diversity as an organization.
cons: Poor compensation, opportunity for growth, and culture as a business. For such a diverse campus, there is still a lot of decolonizing that needs to take place.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Healthy environment to work in
cons: Not enough work exposure to continue

pros: Set your own hours and great coworkers
cons: There are no cons here

pros: flexible hours and great part-time experience
cons: "exception funding" - which is a replacement for "work study" (need-based funding) is hard to come by

pros: Community, diversity, environment, friendliness, amazing students
cons: Room for upward mobility, resources, financial stability, fair pay/raises

pros: it was the best to work
cons: it very did not like the people working there

job_title: Creative Director in Baldwin Park, CA
pros: It's a wonderful community and atmosphere
cons: There are none at all

review_title: Working with the Adminstration is a nightmare
pros: I ran one of the College's departments, so most of the time the administration of the College was pretty hands-off.  They would usually let us make our own decisions regarding the direction of the department, simply because they didn't have the time or the inclination to even have an opinion.
cons: When I did have interactions with the upper Administration, they were condescending, clueless, and seemed to be incapable of making an intelligent decision.

job_title: Student Aide, Human Resources in New York, NY
pros: The best reasons to work here include the general, friendly environment and the openness of staff if you have any questions or concerns related to the position.
cons: Some of the challenges of working here include the pacing, when things are slow they're very slow and when things pick up, they really pick up, you have to be flexible

review_title: Whittier College Is Choice for the Small College Experience
pros: Professors all care about you and will take the time to meet with you when needed.  The community in general is very supportive and helpful.
cons: Scholarships do not protect students from increases in costs.  The administration only cares about money and chooses policies that benefit the bottom line at the expense of the students.

review_title: Don't work here, it's that bad
job_title: Campus Safety Officer in Whittier, CA
pros: It's very lenient place to workbecause of how corrupt this place is. You can get away with almost anything cause they are afraid  of getting sued or you have stuff on superiors.
cons: Really this place is a joke, incompetent leadership, my manager had to lie to try to gain respect but we all know he was never a cop. Hr is shady and cant be trusted. They take care of there own, so if your not shady or corrupt they will try to fire you for going against  the status quo.

review_title: Easy extra money for students with work-study
job_title: Financial Accounting Tutor in Whittier, CA
pros: You have almost no work most of the time, and the concepts taught are simple if you have a basic understanding of accounting terms. Flexible schedule and little supervision from upper levels.
cons: Minimum wage. Annoying mandatory  meetings and trainings, although you can avoid them with a valid excuse.

review_title: Great experience as Academic Coach at Whittier College
pros: Very understanding employers, gave lots of time off for student activities. Lots of employee appreciation events and perks. Community work setting.
cons: Not enough oversight. Impersonal- I never dealt with upper management, only my immediate supervisor.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: Quality of life balance between work and home life.  People are great to work with.
cons: Poor financial growth on career and salary.  Can be difficult to keep morale up without incentives.

review_title: Pretty campus, Not so pretty pay!
pros: Most of the people you work with are engaging and fun. Vacation and sick time accrue quickly. Retirement match is really good.
cons: The pay is much lower than other institutions in the area.

job_title: Phonathon Student Caller in Whittier, CA
pros: Didn't need work study. Highest paying job on campus. No laborous. Social atmosphere.
cons: Asking people for money. Getting yelled at by angry alumni/family/friends of the college

review_title: Easy if you know the subject
